attributes.action: Issue an RAF centenary medal to all serving RAF personnel.
attributes.background: The RAF celebrates its centenary year in 2018 and given its illustrious past and its continued contribution to the safety and security of the United Kingdom, a centenary medal should be issued to all serving members of the RAF who achieve permanent service within the Royal Air Force during 2018.

attributes.action: Extend gender pay gap reporting rules to cover ethnicity pay gap
attributes.background: In April 2017, the government put into law a practice where employers with 250 or more employees must publish and report specific figures about their gender pay gap. We the undersigned call on the government to extend these reporting rules to ethnicity pay gap.
attributes.additional_details:
Several companies and institutions have voluntarily published ethnicity pay gap data, which suggests ethnicity pay gap is as much of a problem as gender pay gap.

Tackling ethnicity pay gap is a national issue, and by making reporting on them mandatory, will, as with requirements to report gender pay gap, provide focus and momentum to enable positive change.

attributes.action: Require teacher training about how to educate children with FASD
attributes.background: I have a child with fetal alcohol spectrum disorder (FASD) and alcohol-related neurodevelopmental disorder (ARND). Teachers need training to educate the thousands of children with this condition. So many of them are being failed because of the lack of awareness within our schools and society.
attributes.additional_details: FASD is a condition a lot of children are born with due to the consumption of alcohol in pregnancy. The condition can range from very mild to very extreme. Children with this condition find their everyday lives very hard ranging from: forming friendships; understanding emotions; having delayed speech; poor short term memory; anger issues; and finding it very hard in education. There are a few organisations out there that offer a lot of advice like NOFAS-UK which help educate people school and other professionals.

attributes.action: Oblige employers to give paid leave for parents of kids with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: Parents of children with chronic illnesses (e.g. juvenile idiopathic arthritis or juvenile diabetes) need time off work for frequent medical appointments, meaning parents often lose their jobs or cannot continue to work, leading to hardship.  The law should provide for permitted, paid time off.

attributes.action: Reconsider the Sugar Tax
attributes.background: With the introduction of the Sugar Tax looming large, consumers are being constantly let down by the attempts of companies to avoid the higher rate of sugar tax and as a result the formulas they are releasing contain much higher levels of artificial sweeteners.
attributes.additional_details:
For some, the full sugar version of a drink not only tastes superior, it has beneficial effects, especially for people with a sensitivity to said artificial sweeteners.

A key example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). This wasn't announced in enough time for diabetic nurses to alter their recommendations.

All the tax is doing is punishing adult consumers. Why should we suffer this draconian approach to obesity?

attributes.action: Stop Anti-abortion Life charity from getting £250k from from UK tampon tax.
attributes.background: The government has confirmed that it is to award a quarter of a million pounds from an unpopular levy on women’s sanitary products to an anti-abortion organisation, despite objections from women’s groups and MPs.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/oct/28/anti-abortion-life-charity-will-get--tampon-tax-funds

attributes.action: Abolish the TV licence
attributes.background: The TV licence fee is supporting the BBC which offers a biased opinion on all matters relating to the British public.

attributes.action: Increase funding for the Royal Army Chaplains' Department.
attributes.background: For centuries the Royal Army Chaplains’ Department has ministered to soldiers and their families in times of war and peace. They provide spiritual support, pastoral care, and moral guidance to all.
attributes.additional_details: The planned closure of bases will lead to fewer Garrison Churches. I believe that they provide spiritual support, moral guidance and pastoral care that is invaluable for our Royal Army and that cannot be learned in a classroom.

attributes.action: Ban all trade of Ivory in the UK with NO exceptions!
attributes.background: Elephants’ biggest threat is the trade in their ivory tusks. The UK has become the world’s leading exporter in ivory in recent years. The newly proposed ban contains exceptions, including musical Instruments and items of "cultural importance". The ban should be TOTAL, with no exceptions.
attributes.additional_details: For more information search for "The Truth Behind Your Ivory Trinkets" on YouTube. This video shows the brutal process by which ivory is harvested and contains more information about the ivory trade. Please watch.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of bowel cancer screening in England to 50.
attributes.background: My wife died aged 56 of secondary cancer after being diagnosed with bowel cancer. One of the consultants informed us the tumour had probably been present for 6 to 8 years. Had she been screened at 50 I believe she would still be alive and the NHS saved tens of thousands of pounds.
attributes.additional_details: Cancer Research UK

attributes.action: Educate children in schools regarding fellow pupils' illnesses and their effects
attributes.background:
Over the past 9 years of supporting sick and disabled children and running Matts Mission Children's Charity over 6 years, we sadly come into contact with many families with sick children that have lost hair or are disabled and are bullied in school.

A subject needs to be put in place to support.
attributes.additional_details: Children all over the world are being diagnosed with a serious illness every day, they go through so much, treatment for an illness such as cancer makes the child's hair fall out. Sadly many children in schools including higher education schools are being called names, spat on, laughed at, wigs pulled off there head. It is getting out of control, it is time these children understood the damage they are causing to the confidence of these sick children. Schools need to help to stop this happening.

attributes.action: Make it the law for children's feelings and wishes to be heard in family court
attributes.background: I want it to be the law that children can voice what they want to happen in family court, in person, by a voice recorded clip to be played or a letter to be read by the judge. Too many children are not being heard, it time to give them a voice.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory dog licence In the UK
attributes.background: We all know in most cases it’s not the dog but the owner at fault. If you are happy to take on the responsibility of the care of a pet dog then you should not be adverse to paying a fair licence fee and being held responsible for the dogs actions.
attributes.additional_details: Let’s only permit responsible people to own dogs. How many times must we read stories of serious injuries or death, mistreated pets attacking adults, children or other dogs. Having adequate licence regulations in place would help weed out and ban future ownership of dogs belonging to people incapable of the task of raising a dog in a caring and responsible manner. If you are a caring dog lover then please support this petition to make life safer and kinder for both owners and dogs.

attributes.action: Abolish Mobile Speed Cameras
attributes.background: The use of mobile speed cameras is increasing generating masses of revenue for local authorities. Current tactics used to target drivers on the roads when going about their daily business is wrong, has a negative impact on lives and contributes only a small percentage to road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
These days it’s easy to speed in modern cars & the police know it so when traveling to work one day in a safe manner they’ll be waiting for you tucked in on some layby.

Law abiding citizens caught by these mobile speed traps feel they’ve been deliberately targeted & criminalised by the organisation set out to protect is in for gain. Millions of drivers fined for speeding over the years have seen nothing in return and whilst this continues what improvements have we seen from all these fines?

attributes.action: Ban processed meat adverts in the UK
attributes.background: Processed meat has been classified as carcinogenic to humans by the WHO. As little as one serving a day increases the risk of diabetes by 50% and heart disease by 42% (guardian) and causes 8,500 cancers every year. Advertisements of it should be banned completely.
attributes.additional_details:
Processed meat was now in a group of 120 proven carcinogens, alongside alcohol, asbestos and tobacco.
The WHO advised that consuming 50g of processed meat a day – equivalent to just a couple of rashers of bacon or one hotdog – would raise the risk of getting bowel cancer by 18% over a lifetime. The consumption of processed meat causes an additional 34,000 worldwide cancer deaths a year,  four times the number of people killed annually on Britain’s roads.
Consuming just 9g of bacon a day – less than a rasher – could significantly raise the risk of developing breast cancer later in life. Jill Pell from Glasgow University says that “it would be misleading” for health authorities to set any safe dose for processed meat “other than zero”. The Guardian.

attributes.action: On Armistice Day 2018, light beacons across the country as a sign of Remembrance
attributes.background:
This year marks the centenary of the end of the Great War.
As a mark of respect to all The Brave who made the ultimate sacrifice and gave their lives for their country, the Government should light Beacons across the country on Armistice Day (November 11th) 2018.

attributes.action: Make every workplace and school complete a mandatory yearly CPR training day.
attributes.background: Many people don't know how to perform a life saving procedure (CPR) due to no fault of their own, but due to their school or work areas not providing this training. I believe more lives will be saved if CPR training is an mandatory training session. I know many people would appreciate this training.

attributes.action: Create a bank holiday to celebrate the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle
attributes.background: Today a spokesperson for the Prime Minister stated there was no intention of holding a bank holiday. People should be allowed to rejoice in the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle. There is precedent for this. A bank holiday was granted for the marriage of The Duke & Duchess of Cambridge.

attributes.action: Bring HMP Service in line with other public services and improve the uniform
attributes.background: The current uniform for HM Prison service is out of date and unpractical. Staff working within prisons are required to wear neckties and white shirts when other public services like the police are not, even though they face the public on a daily basis. Polo shirts are smarter and more practical.
attributes.additional_details: The current rules regarding the uniform are fluid and are at the discretion of establishment Governors, some staff are not required to wear ties throughout the summer but must wear them for winter periods. The ties offer no protection from the cold and do not improve the working practice of staff, in fact can be described as a barrier between staff and prisoners. The money saved on producing white shirts and ties could easily be used to improve rehabilitation of offenders.

attributes.action: To not spend £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust
attributes.background:
Why are we spending £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust? Great Britain didn't carry out this atrocity but spent years fighting at war because of it. 
Surely this is tribute enough? 
Spend our money on more pressing matters at home , e.g.  NHS etc.

attributes.action: Grant student mothers the same protections as working mothers
attributes.background: Higher education institutions are required under employment law to make maternity provisions for working mothers, yet there is no legal requirement ensuring the same protections for students who are mothers. This blind-spot has led to student mothers facing avoidable adversity in higher education.
attributes.additional_details:
In spite of the Equality Act 2010,  the rights of student mothers are primarily determined at their institution's discretion. Student mothers are easily marginalised and often squeezed out of the education system as a result.

Access to flexible working, maternity leave and breastfeeding facilities are examples of legal entitlements held by workers. There is no reason for student mothers not to be equally protected, when they are just as vulnerable to maternity discrimination. This must change.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age to 21
attributes.background: I feel as everything else is going up like smoking/drinking and this shouldn't be any different also it would reduce voting fraud.

attributes.action: Legally recognise non-binary gender identities
attributes.background:
Multiple countries legally recognize non-binary or third gender classifications. They are available to people with gender identities that differ from their sex assigned at birth. It’s important we support our lgbt community.

Sourced from wikipedia
attributes.additional_details:
Some non-western societies have long recognized transgender and/or non-binary people as a third gender, though this may not (or may only recently)[4] include formal legal recognition

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legal_recognition_of_non-binary_gender

attributes.action: Encourage British Sign Language in KS1 in Schools
attributes.background:
Being a child of Deaf  Parents I am deeply passionate about having Sign Language involved in Schools.
With a population of 11 million Chilren Deaf or Hearing impaired in our Country I feel it would be of huge benefit to teach Sign language at a young age..
attributes.additional_details:
With alot of deaf Schools closing and Deaf Hearing impaired Children now being taught in mainsteam Schools with Classroom support.
Socially they are being affected..
Its a lonely place for Deaf Children Socially.
With a huge shortage of interpreters and some Deaf adults having to wait almost a week for support. I feel Children will enjoy sign language enough to encourage them to feel as passionate as myself and gain qualifications.
Lets make a bridge bring hearing and deaf together.

attributes.action: Halt Taunton Deane District Council taking over West Somerset District Council.
attributes.background: The obliteration of West Somerset Council will reduce electoral its representation, will centralise services in the more prosperous and more urbanised Taunton Deane and distance people in West Somerset from the delivery of services by making those delivering the services less accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed merger was based on a deficit accumulated by West Somerset. The deficit, that is forecast to drop dramatically, is not surprising given West Somerset's relative deprivation and the unfair distribution of the rural grant that pays a city like Bristol more per head in than the deeply rural and under populated West Somerset.

Construction of Hinkley C nuclear power station and the government's policy of local councils retaining business rates will change the fortunes of West Somerset.

attributes.action: Less burden of proof for post war commonwealth citizens seeking  naturalisation
attributes.background: Commonwealth citizens who were invited to relocate during the UK's recruitment drive are now in their retirement years facing deportation. They entered the UK legally to help build post war Britain & have paid taxes in the UK. They are now discovering naturalisation was necessary but never happened.
attributes.additional_details: The 1971 Immigration Act gave people already settled in Britain Indefinite leave to Remain. These children are now adults and most are struggling to gather enough documents to convince the Home Office that they arrived before the cut off point. Some are being taken to Immigration Removal Centres, refused cancer treatment, becoming homeless and dismissed from their place of work as well as being refused any recourse to public funds which they have paid into for the past 50 plus years.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my husband takes out our daughter and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! This means he either has to change her on the floor, bench or leave her until she gets home. This is not ideal.
attributes.additional_details:
There are so many more involved dads nowadays, diversification of families and opportunity of shared maternity leave. We need to make things more accessible for dads too!

Where changing facility are not in unisex toilets like disabled ones, i propose this be a legal requirement for these to be in both female and male toilets.

attributes.action: Government to provide mental health screening for all new fathers.
attributes.background: While new mothers have screening for their mental health, unfortunately fathers who also have a history if depression do not at present. With all recent research on Fathers we must provide an assessment for all parents as the biggest killer in men under fifty in the UK is SUICIDE.

attributes.action: Ban the Government P.R.N. scheme - For Plastic Recycling export profits.
attributes.background: The P.R.N. Is a scheme set up by the UK Government, for recycling exporters to make huge profits. Sadly, this scheme allows tonnes of unrecyclable/hazardous plastics to be shipped overseas. Which ends up polluting the environment. We could deal with our plastics in the UK, if the PRN was scrapped.
attributes.additional_details:
This would in turn, create many jobs here in th UK.
Would ensure we know 100% what happens with our recycling / plastics. 
Would help reduce wrecking the planet and killing wildlife. 

If you need proof. Check out 'Ocean Rescue: Dirty Business' on Sky Atlantic!

attributes.action: Require all MLM schemes to publish & display annual income disclosures.
attributes.background: 99.7% of people who pay to join a multi-level marketing scheme lose money. Not all MLM schemes provide an income disclosure statement that includes ALL participants who've joined. This needs to be a requirement so people can make an informed decision before paying to join.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.statisticbrain.com/mlm-direct-selling-statistics/

attributes.action: Make all fireworks silent in Britain
attributes.background: We all know that fireworks terrify wildlife and can cause catastrophic consequences to our animals, not only they suffer but those with psychological issues with noise can become traumatised at this time of year (PTSD etc). Britain can use this compassion to respect our soldiers and animals

attributes.action: Stop charging VAT on vet treatments/animal medicinces
attributes.background: So it's just cost me £278 to have a cut stitched, of this £46 was VAT, as this is for medical treatment to animals, why do we have to pay VAT, imagine how much would be charged on a more complicated operation, £20 in every £100

attributes.action: Make specialist training a requirement for licensing of zoos with exotic animals
attributes.background: Currently, there are no legal requirements for a person to have gained any formal training to be awarded a licence for a zoo or sanctuary that contains exotic animals. Through the lack of expertise and knowledge this leads to the maltreatment of animals in captivity.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of specialist training leads to the maltreatment and fatality of exotic animals and risk to both public and staff. The recent death of two large cats - one which was asphyxiated during incompetent handling and the other which escaped and was euthanised when deemed to be a threat to the public - could have been avoided had appropriate training been required of the operators. Other cases of neglect of exotic animals at licensed establishments have been made public, as have deaths of handlers

attributes.action: 16 and 17 year olds should be allowed to vote in any future Brexit referendum
attributes.background: Young people are affected more deeply than older people by the result of the Brexit referendum, as their lives will be changed for very many more years. However, young people aged 16 to 17 were not allowed to vote in the 2016 referendum, in contrast to the Scottish independence referendum of 2014.
attributes.additional_details: Are 16-17 year olds immature people, not to be trusted with serious political decisions? I don't think so. These days, teenagers are hounded with pressure to find work experience or summer courses during their holidays, even if they have only just finished their GCSEs.  When teenagers are forced to be hard-working adults so early, the least they deserve is to have some say over their future. If there is another referendum on any aspect of Brexit, teenagers aged 16-17 ought to have a voice.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to print information of a death U'18 without parental consent.
attributes.background: Michael, 17 years old, took his own life. Yet in the coroners inquest the press were allowed to hear every detail and print their own interpretation of the events and outcome of the inquest. Although in their article it was miss worded and irrelevant. Causing further grief to the family.
attributes.additional_details: This caused more grief for the family, with the press printing irrelevant information leading up to the events. It was confirmed by the coroner that Michael Nicholas, 17, took his own life on his own accord under no other influence. Although substances were found in the body. The press released information to make the public and readers think otherwise with their unneeded wording and wrong information. Due to their own take on events an article was released to the public and Mikey's friends and family.

attributes.action: Delay the sale of RBS until the taxpayer has made a profit on the bailout
attributes.background: The government bought a 72% stake in RBS after the Financial crisis and has kept it in public ownership whilst it was posting losses. This year it finally posted a healthy profit, so the Tories have decided to sell it. We will be making a £26 billion loss on this purchase.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ft.com/content/555bfe08-cf99-11e7-9dbb-291a884dd8c6

attributes.action: Fund a veterans' bus pass for all veterans
attributes.background: The Government should demonstrate its gratitude for what all the Veterans have done for this Country so this is why I would like to start this petition.

attributes.action: Make sign language part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Communication should be for all. By making British sign language part of the curriculum, we would offer inclusion and equality for those using signing to support their daily communication. Learning signing would enable all children to interact despite their disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Following Down's Syndrome day and working in the early years sector my passion for this has spiked. 
We learn to communicate during our early years and language is something we hear all around us everyday to enable us to communicate effectively, yet we don't all consider teaching signing as routine to enable communication for all. Doing this would offer inclusion for those using signing daily and enable others to communicate with their peers.

attributes.action: Let mothers be named on marriage certificates
attributes.background:
Currently marriage certificates only allow the fathers name on them and not mothers.

This petition aims to bring the marriage certificate into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Put pressure on Israel to free the Palestinian 16 year old teenager Ahed Tamimi
attributes.background: Ahed Tamimi, a prominent 16-year-old Palestinian activist, was reported to have been detained during a pre-dawn raid on her home by the Israeli army and border police in the occupied West Bank.
attributes.additional_details: Ahed's mother, Nariman, is also said to have been arrested on Tuesday afternoon during a visit to Ahed at an Israeli police station.

attributes.action: Increase funding to Children's Mental Health services in the UK.
attributes.background: In 2015, the government pledged an extra £1.4 billion over five years to “transform” CAMHS (Children and Adolescent Mental Health Services). CCGs (Clinical Comission Groups) used this money for other priorities, or something completely different. Children's Mental Health Services need more funding.
attributes.additional_details: References: https://youngminds.org.uk/about-us/media-centre/press-releases/children-s-mental-health-funding-not-going-where-it-should-be/

attributes.action: Extend the 16-19 transport bursary to pupils placed in an Independent setting.
attributes.background: This bursary is supposed to enable pupils from families on a low income to access education and/ or training by meeting transport costs. The eligibility assumes pupils are not in Independent settings, but local authorities who cannot provide for some with additional needs often use such placements.
attributes.additional_details: The result is that families on a low income with children who have additional needs are financially discriminated against. Often the reason many families with a child who has additional needs are on a low income is due to the care needs of that child.

attributes.action: Mental Health Education and coping strategies to be taught in schools
attributes.background: Let's look to prevention rather than cure and enable young people with awareness skills and coping strategies taught in schools so as to enable them to not feel so helpless when faced with depression, anxiety and the like further in life.

attributes.action: To demand that the cost of the Royal Wedding is not met from public funds.
attributes.background: It is reported that the cost of the forthcoming Royal Wedding is to cost the UK taxpayer in excess of £30 million. Last month, it was revealed that the Royal family has used extensive offshore vehicles to minimise their contribution to the public purse. UK debt is at the highest recorded level.
attributes.additional_details: The austerity measures imposed by Government has led to drastic cuts in public services and local authority spending. In June, fire ravaged through a West London tower block when it’s reported that just £5K would have been needed for fireproof cladding. The crisis in public finances are endangering those most vulnerable in society, but we are being asked to fund a lavish society wedding, whilst the aristocracy don't pay their fair share.

attributes.action: Ask Parliament to debate the Basic Income
attributes.background: Britain is the 6th richest country on earth, yet 1/3rd of British children live in poverty. 3.8 million Brits in work live in poverty. A majority of people live paycheck to paycheck. The botched rollout of universal credits made matters worse. It's time for parliament to debate the basic income.
attributes.additional_details:
In the face of these devastating facts, many people have argued that giving everyone a small, monthly sum of money to cover their basic needs, without any work requirement, would significantly salvage the situation. This is what's called a basic income.

All we ask is for parliament to put all the ideas that may help deal with the issues outlined above on the table. That is literally their job. It's what they get paid to do. Ask parliament to debate the basic income.

attributes.action: For all schools in England to teach students the God Save The Queen.
attributes.background: For the British government to make it mandatory for all schools in England to teach all their students God Save The Queen.

attributes.action: Force motorway service areas (MSAs) provide security for visiting HGVs at night.
attributes.background: I am the operator of a single lorry. In two months I have had six holes cut in my trailer curtains and a braking system cable stolen while at MSAs. Parking at MSAs costs up to £34. I have been told by an operator that they don't have to do any more. Damage, load and fuel theft happens very often.
attributes.additional_details:
Returning to secure yards increases empty mileage, emissions and costs. It also increases fleet sizes and congestion. Some loads can't be delivered in one day and require overnight parking away from base.
A security guard from 20:00 to 06:00 would cost an MSA around £102, just 4 trucks per night. 
The cost of my repairs is £850 + VAT (approx) in 8 weeks, equal to a drivers wage. Increased costs for firms mean higher prices at the shops.
Visit http://ninefiftysix.co.uk/tag/petition-2018/ for more

attributes.action: Make the 16/30 free hours worth of childcare available to children from 6 months
attributes.background: The government offers 16 hours worth of free childcare when your child is two and either 15/30 free hours for children aged 3-4, what about free childcare for children younger than this for all the parents that want to work but will struggle to do so with the current fees for childcare?
attributes.additional_details: The current system is out dated and ridiculous.  There are plenty of families/single parents that want to go out to work when their child is a few months old but are unable to do so because of the crippling prices of childcare fees.  For this reason the government needs to start the free childcare entitlement age to 6+ months, so that every family that wants to go out and work can do so without working to just cover nursery fees.

attributes.action: Take no military action in Syria using UK forces or weapons.
attributes.background: The cost of such action cannot be justified if public money is not currently  available to support vital health, social welfare, policing, ambulance, education and local authority services in our country.

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for pedophiles and sharing images of child pornography
attributes.background:
We want tougher sentences for pedophiles and the sharing and owning of images of porn a graphic material of children.

Children who suffer abuse are affected in the worst way possible. They don't get to do a sentence then it's all over, they are sentenced to life!
attributes.additional_details: We need to protect our children and break the cycle of abuse by harsh sentences and strict monitoring. At the moment pedophiles get short sentences and probation. This does not deter them from further abusing children.  A child's innocence and trust is gone forever. Their veiw of the world and adults changes in that moment and they'll never ever really feel safe again. Our view of the world is shaped by our early experiences. 25 to Life imprisonment is the only solution to protect our children and stop abuse.
